remarks: The orthocomplement of a kernel is an atom iff the double orthocomplement is not the vector space.  (Contributed by NM, 1-Jan-2015.)
statement:
dochkrsat2.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dochkrsat2.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochkrsat2.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochkrsat2.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
dochkrsat2.a $e |- A = ( LSAtoms ` U ) $.
dochkrsat2.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
dochkrsat2.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
dochkrsat2.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dochkrsat2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
dochkrsat2 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) ) =/= V <-> ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) e. A ) ) $.
